column3: Central Line Associated Bloodstream Infection (ICU + select Wards)
column9: Better Than Average, Average, Below Average
column13: Central Line Associated Blood Stream Infection.
column14: A serious hospital-acquired infection that occurs when bacteria enter the bloodstream through a central line. CLABSI can cause severe complications, including sepsis, prolonged hospital stays, and increased mortality. CLABSI is life-threatening and preventable through strict sterile techniques and proper catheter care.

column3: Catheter Associated Urinary Tract Infections (ICU + select Wards)
column9: Better Than Average, Average, Below Average
column13: Catheter Associated Urinary Tract Infection.
column14: An infection that develops when bacteria enter the urinary tract through a catheter. It can cause discomfort, fever, and more severe complications like kidney infections or bloodstream infections. CAUTI can prolong hospital stays and lead to antibiotic resistance, making prevention through proper catheter care and early removal essential.

column9: Better Than Average, Average, Below Average
column13: Surgical Site Infection - Colon Surgery.
column14: A bacterial infection at the incision site after colon surgery, leading to redness, swelling, drainage, or deeper tissue infections. SSIs can cause severe complications, prolonged hospital stays, and the need for additional treatments or surgeries.

column9: Better Than Average, Average, Below Average
column13: Surgical Site Infection - Hysterectomy.
column14: A bacterial infection at the incision site after hysterectomy (uterus removal), leading to redness, swelling, drainage, or deeper tissue infections. SSIs can cause severe complications, prolonged hospital stays, and the need for additional treatments or surgeries.

column9: Better Than Average, Average, Below Average
column13: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus Bacteremia.
column14: A bacterial infection resistant to many common antibiotics, making it difficult to treat. MRSA can lead to severe infections, including bloodstream infections and pneumonia, increasing the risk of complications, prolonged hospital stays, and higher healthcare costs.

column9: Better Than Average, Average, Below Average
column13: Clostridium Difficile.
column14: A bacterial infection that causes severe diarrhea and colitis. C. diff can lead to prolonged hospital stays, serious complications, and even life-threatening conditions, especially for older adults and those with weakened immune systems.
